Early Access Review

Bought the game for the Momiji and presidential candididate emoticons, stayed for the humor.

This isn't really a game per se; it's more of a simple simulation. You take different famous people, stick them into an arena, and let them brawl to the very finish. You have very little to no input on the match itself, but you set the fighters and the match settings and then let the game begin.

The real beauty of the game isn't in the match itself, but in the Updates Log, where you can monitor the action of all the participants and see what they're doing. An update might be as dramatic as one man spearing another and killing him, or it might be as simple as someone taking a bath. However, the ridiculousness of each update provides the entertainment here. You migt see that a spiteful crow has stolen Beethoven's bread roll, or that Steve Jobs just gouged out Franz Kafka's eye. The combination of silly events and placement of historical figures allows the game to work.

However, if you're not looking for that kind of humor, but instead an actual game, where you can interact with the environment and feel like you are accomplishing something, then this game is probably not for you.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Okay, before I anything, I just want to let everyone know that I do really like this game, and i'll probably buy it again at some point. In fact, the main reason i'm recommending this is because it is SO MUCH FUN in that first hour of gameplay. Just watching some of history's greatest people(and a stray dog) fight to the death is actually awesome, and just watching and seeing what happens will really brighten your day.

But after an hour, I say it loses most of it's touch. I still am able to get pleasure out of it, and my brother loved seeing some of the stuff happening, and he usually hates these types of games. But a big reason it starts to get boring, is because A LOT of stuff starts to repeat. The main reason it's so much fun for the first hour is because you get to see a lot of stuff happen that you weren't expecting. But soon, you see just about everything the game has to show at the moment. Granted, they do allow you to create new characters and events, and that's pretty fun. I actually made a YouTuber arena, full of some of my favorites and least favorites fighting to the death, and that was one of my favorite things to watch all week.

And for S2, this is still worth a buy if you are looking for a good hour or two of fun. But at the moment, I think i'm gonna try to refund it, and just buy it again later. When it has more to offer, i'll be one of the many who returns to give this game another shot. But until than, I think i'm just gonna play Brantsteele.

Pros :
* Really fun for an hour or two
* Plenty of ways for the contestants to interact, even if some are repeated a bit too much
* Allows you to create your own cast of characters to fight
* Able to directly influence the combat by allowing you to add landmines, send in packages, and start death events

Cons :
* Gets boring due to lack of content in some fields
* Feels limited due to the concept
* Isn't technically a game, acts more like an interactable simulation

Personal Score : 6/10(It's Okay!))
